data.title: 101 Dalmatians Kids â€” ROSEVILLE THEATRE ARTS ACADEMY
data.meta_description: Pet owners, Roger and Anita, live happily in London with their Dalmatians, Pongo and Perdita, stalwart dogs devoted to raising their puppies. Everything is quiet until Anita's former classmate, the monstrous Cruella De Vil, plots to steal the puppies for her new fur coat. The Dalmatians rally all th
data.text:
Tuesday Cast

Tuesday Youth Workshop: Ages 8-15

The Youth program offers the unique opportunity for every student to participate in every show, with no double casting. We do not mandate parent volunteer hours or require parents to purchase a certain number of tickets. We focus our musical theatre training by teaching the basics of singing, dancing, and acting. Students experience a full "tech week" with lights, live musicians, costumes, and props, which starts the Sunday before the performances.

*With Disney or other productions that we do not write ourselves, not every student will have lines. Those productions put more focus on an ensemble.

Dates: August 16th, 23rd, 30th, September 6th, 13th, 20th and 27th 5:00-8:00pm

Mandatory Tech Rehearsals: October 2nd 11:00am-2:00pm, October 3rd 4:00-6:00pm, October 4th 4:00-6:00pm, October 5th 4:00-6:00pm and October 6th 4:00-6:00pm

Performances: October 7th Call 5:00pm/Show 7:00pm and October 8th Call 1:00pm/Show 2:00pm (ASL INTERPRETED)

Tuesday Little Ones Workshop: Ages 4-7

The Little Ones program offers the unique opportunity for every student to participate in every performance, with no double casting. We do not mandate parent volunteer hours or require parents to purchase a certain number of tickets. We focus our musical theatre training by teaching the basics of singing, dancing, and acting.

Dates: August 23rd, 30th, September 6th, 13th, 20th and 27th 4:00-5:00pm

Mandatory Tech Rehearsals: October 5th 5:30-6:00pm, October 6th 4:00-4:30pm

Performances: October 7th Call 6:00pm/Show 7:00pm and October 8th Call 1:00pm/Show 2:00pm (ASL INTERPRETED)

Wednesday Cast

Wednesday Youth Workshop: Ages 8-15

The Youth program offers the unique opportunity for every student to participate in every show, with no double casting. We do not mandate parent volunteer hours or require parents to purchase a certain number of tickets. We focus our musical theatre training by teaching the basics of singing, dancing, and acting. Students experience a full "tech week" with lights, live musicians, costumes, and props, which starts the Sunday before the performances.

*With Disney or other productions that we do not write ourselves, not every student will have lines. Those productions put more focus on an ensemble.

Dates: August 17th, 24th, 31st, September 7th, 14th, 21st and 28th 5:00-8:00pm

Mandatory Tech Rehearsals: October 2nd 2:30-5:30pm, October 3rd 6:00-8:00pm, October 4th 6:00-8:00pm, October 5th 6:00-8:00pm and October 6th 6:00-8:00pm

Performances: October 8th Call 5:00pm/Show 7:00pm and October 9th Call 1:00pm/Show 2:00pm

Wednesday Little Ones Workshop: Ages 4-7

The Little Ones program offers the unique opportunity for every student to participate in every performance, with no double casting. We do not mandate parent volunteer hours or require parents to purchase a certain number of tickets. We focus our musical theatre training by teaching the basics of singing, dancing, and acting.

Dates: August 24th, 31st, September 7th, 14th, 21st and 28th 4:00-5:00pm

Mandatory Tech Rehearsals: October 5th 6:00-6:30pm and October 6th 6:00-6:30pm
